intro: Henriettella gibberosa, commonly known as the hairy scurfpea, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to survive in dry, harsh environments. Henriettella gibberosa has small, elliptical leaves and produces pods that contain several seeds. It plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat and is of interest to botanists studying drought-resistant flora.
